results.title: Mallee - land of challenge
results.creator_credit: R.G. Downes and Soil Conservation Authority of Victoria
results.brief_description: How the Mallee farmer is overcoming the problems of former bad land use and wind erosion by modern agricultural methods. Soil conservation competitions, educational field days, and advisory services also are helping the farmer to improve land use. The film shows how this vast Mallee country has a big production potential for cereals, wool and meat.

results.title: Male and female in plants and animals
results.brief_description: Introduces the concept of male and female in plants and animals. Animation is used to show the locations of reproductive organs in different kind plants and animals: algae, flowering plants, insects, fish, amphibians, birds, and mammals, including humans. Through microphotography, various kinds of sperm cells and egg cells are closely examined. A human sperm is observed entering an egg cell.

results.title: Making their senses make sense
results.creator_credit: Elsie McKibbin and Center for Developmental and Learning Disorders
results.brief_description: Discusses methods to care for and explores different activities to help teach children who are perceptually disabled. These children may find difficulty in learning, refining motor skills, and coping with safety aspects in everyday life.

results.title: Making pottery. No. 1
results.creator_credit: Harvig Jensen and Hartvig Jensen Film Productions
results.brief_description: Shows how raw clay is processed in preparation for modelling. Demonstrations show a jug and a flower pot being made; creative use of engraving and decorating; the final firing and glazing processes.

results.title: Magic Orchard
results.brief_description: Animated oriental fairy tale. A drought stricken village incurs further suffering when it is attacked by bandits. However, their luck changes when they find a pot of gold. The gold is used to buy some caged birds which, when set free, return to the village with seeds, from which grow a magic orchard. The orchard brings prosperity to the village, and its magic protects them from the bandits. (No narration or dialogue.)

results.title: Magic of nature. No. 3. The Ladybird
results.brief_description: Aphids, one of the most common and destructive garden pests, do much damage each spring to growing plants. Their enemy is the tiny carniverous ladybird which consumes them in large numbers. The film, using close-up photography, records the 8-week life span of the ladybird.
